channel.title: Ipod touch!
channel.description: is there a way to host a server on a ipod touch? if you can make an app for it to host that would be AWSOME!

item.title: Ipod touch!
item.dc:creator: @_BBLLAARRGGHH __--BBLLAARRGGHH--__
item.description:
@_BBLLAARRGGHH wrote:

But it would work. And it should be done for a " 'cause I can" not " 'cause it’s good/not laggy/24/7"

Read full topic

item.title: Ipod touch!
item.dc:creator: @johno2 johno2
item.description:
@johno2 wrote:

[quote=“h4x0r88, post:7, topic:288738”]english? and an ipod has alot of gaming power look up DOOM: Ressurection
if an ipod can play a complex game such as that i think it should be able to host a light weght source. PLUS there IS comand prompt for ipod touches![br][br][size=1]Posted on: July 14, 2009, 11:25:25 am[/size][hr][quote author=zyle1992 link=topic=381745.msg2868265#msg2868265 date=1247592197]
If you could magically, give the iPod touch 1-2 gigs of ram, than ya, it’s possible(I upgraded my xbox to host a server, but it’s a long story…)
[/quote] See this is a good answer![/quote]

Dude, seriously, there is no change for an Ipod touch to host an RSPS, for one, you need a REALLY fast upload, and Ipods don’t, next around 2Gb ram, they don’t have that, next about a 2GH Proccessor, oh guess what! They don’t have that! You’ll also need a static IP, contact IPS, you’ll also need it on 24/7, also, you wont be able to use ur Ipod Touch because of lagg/sync issues…

Read full topic

@killkaramage wrote:

YES definatly! but acctully you must go to your local electrition or any person handy with stuff like pcs and electronics, you get them to connect your ipod touch mem and gigs as in the 8gb and etc stuff to ur pc ram(people dont say its not possible) and it will only gain a little bit but you can still run it perfect without a lagg! if its 24/7 ur internet will screw up! how i know this well i did this with my psp my cuzin linked it for me psp vs ipod touch i think ipod touch is better and can manage!

item.title: Ipod touch!
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

You couldn’t get more than one person on. Yes there is a JVM in Cydia, but it’s poor. The iPod has very little RAM (256mb IIRC), its processor is terrible, and it would have to be constantly connected to your wi-fi, which as soon as the iPod locks, it shuts off the adapter to preserve battery.

Read full topic

item.title: Ipod touch!
item.dc:creator: @x_blitz_x x blitz x
item.description:
@x_blitz_x wrote:

[quote=“Memory, post:26, topic:288738”]News flash!

IPOD TOUCH = Apple = MAC

You won’t be able to run a WINDOWS program on a MAC/APPLE PRODUCT!

And, even if u did end up getting it to work, the lagg would be so intense, your computer would be making a screeching sound and overheat your speakers,motherboard,graphics card, and ur modem/router![/quote]
News Flash!

You’re a dumb ass. Java is universal language, which means it can run on any OS.

Read full topic

__--BBLLAARRGGHH--__:

Who cares, ontopic now, A server WOULD NOT run EFFICIENTLY off an IPod or IPhone

He didn’t ask that.
He simply asked would it run, not how efficient it would be.

And as an IPod Touch can have the JVM installed and has 128MB RAM, the simple answer is yes.
